SUMMARY
Data engineer and data scientist with a Master of Science in Data Science and Machine Learning and hands-on experience designing data pipelines, analytics workflows, and ML-enabled systems. Former AWS Solutions Architect Intern, where I built scalable, cloud-based analytics and NLP pipelines processing large batch of records. Strong foundation in Python, SQL, cloud services, applied machine learning and AI, with a focus on reproducibility, evaluation, and real-world decision-making. Interested in leveraging data, AI and the cloud to drive insights and automation in dynamic environments.

PROJECTS

Alfred â€” Agentic Job Search Assistant | Sep 2025 â€“ Present

Implemented a Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) system using PostgreSQL with pgvector.

Applied cosine similarity to match candidates to job postings, reducing application time by ~60%.

Conducted LLM evaluation using human-in-the-loop and LLM-as-judge techniques.

Developed a retrieval-augmented analytics agent that converts natural language questions into safe, explainable SQL insights.

Combined a star-schema analytics warehouse with business-rule and metadata retrieval (RAG) to ensure queries are grounded in approved definitions before execution.

Leveraged LangChain for ReAct agent orchestration, FAISS for vector retrieval, and an OLAP-first architecture with a migration path to Postgres.

Wrapped the system in Streamlit for interactive user input and real-time response display.

Added Python-based post-processing for query result analysis, including visualizations and summary statistics.

title: About
text:
Profile


Darwhin Gomez is a data and software engineer with a strong foundation in data engineering, analytics, and machine learning. He recently completed a Master of Science in Data Science from the School of Professional Studies at the City University of New York, where he worked extensively with real-world datasets, statistical modeling, and end-to-end data workflows. His experience includes building data pipelines, performing feature engineering, and developing machine learning models using Python, SQL, and R, with an emphasis on reproducibility, evaluation rigor, and practical decision-making.
In 2025, he interned as a Solutions Architect at Amazon Web Services (AWS), where he designed and deployed AI-powered solutions across multiple AWS services with a focus on scalability, reliability, and performance. In 2024, he interned as a Software and Product Developer at WOPLLI, contributing to research and proof-of-concept development for Decentralized Identity (DID) and Verifiable Credentials (VC) systems, as well as building a web application for issuing and managing digital credentials. He also served as a Help Desk Intern with the Office of Technology for the Mayor of New York City, providing technical support and troubleshooting for city employees.
While pursuing his Bachelorâ€™s degree in Computer Systems Technology from the New York City College of Technology, Darwhin worked as a Teaching Assistant for IT courses through the Research Foundation of the City University of New York, supporting students in professional IT systems and support coursework.  Outside of his professional work, Darwhin is a devoted husband and father of two. He enjoys spending time with his family, exploring emerging technologies, reading epic fantasy and science fiction, and following New York sports.

title: Darwhin Gomez
text:
Featured Projects
A selection of projects that demonstrate my experience in data engineering, analytics, machine learning, and AI-powered systems.

Agent0 â€“ RAG-Grounded Analytics Agent
Agent0 is a retrieval-augmented analytics agent that converts natural language questions into safe, explainable SQL insights.
The system combines a star-schema analytics warehouse with business-rule and metadata retrieval (RAG) to ensure that generated queries are grounded in approved definitions before execution. Agent0 uses an agentic workflow to decide when to retrieve context, execute SQL, or perform post-processing in Python.
Key ideas behind Agent0:

Semantic grounding via RAG to reduce SQL hallucinations

Clear separation of reasoning, retrieval, and execution

OLAP-first design with a migration path to Postgres or cloud warehouses

Guardrails and auditability beyond prompt-only approaches

Tech stack: DuckDB (prototype OLAP) â†’ Postgres/Redshift-style warehouse, FAISS (vector retrieval), LangChain (agent orchestration), Python (analytics + SQL), LLM-agnostic (currently using GPT-4o via OpenAI API).

Repo: https://github.com/DW8888/agent0

Architecture & design: Agent0 details




Alfred â€“ AI Job Assistant (RAG)
Alfred originated as both a practical solution to streamline my job search and as a Masterâ€™s capstone project. It is a RAG-powered job application assistant that generates tailored resumes and cover letters based on user profiles and job descriptions.
Key ideas behind Alfred:

Uses vector databases and cosine similarity to retrieve relevant profile and job information

Leverages LLMs to generate customized application materials

Built with FastAPI and PostgreSQL/pgvector for efficient retrieval

Includes a React/Next.js frontend with a FastAPI backend for end-to-end user interaction

Tech stack: FastAPI, PostgreSQL/pgvector, Python, Next.js/React (TypeScript), OpenAI-powered RAG workflows.

Repo: https://github.com/DW8888/alfred
Architecture & design: Alfred design




Fraud Isolation Case Study
This project was developed as part of a case study in my data science program, where I built an Isolation Forest model to detect fraudulent financial transactions.
The notebook includes data preprocessing, exploratory data analysis, feature engineering, model training, and evaluation â€” demonstrating my ability to apply machine learning techniques to real-world problems.
Tech stack: Python, Jupyter Notebook, scikit-learn, pandas, matplotlib, seaborn.
Notebook: - Fraud Isolation Case Study
